conclusion: The task is to predict which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
Points A, B, and C release liquid, and the liquid flows downward through diagonal bars and into containers D or E.
Points A, B, and C release blue, yellow, and pink liquids respectively.
Diagonal bars in various colors obstruct or redirect the flow of liquids.
House-shaped containers at the bottom are colored blue, purple, and gray.
The blue container is on the left, purple in the middle, and gray on the right.
The blue liquid from point A flows downward and hits a diagonal bar.
The diagonal bar directs the blue liquid towards the left.
The yellow liquid from point B flows downward and hits a diagonal bar.
The diagonal bar directs the yellow liquid towards the right.
The pink liquid from point C flows downward and hits a diagonal bar.
The diagonal bar directs the pink liquid further to the right.
The blue liquid is directed towards the left and might end up in the blue container.
The yellow liquid is directed towards the right and might cross paths with the blue liquid or follow a separate path to the containers.
The pink liquid moves straight down without much interference and might end up in the gray container.
